DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: OLIVEIRA, L. R.;de Oliveira, L.;de Oliveira, L. R.;de Oliveira, Luciana;DE OLIVEIRA, L R;DE OLIVEIRA, LUCIANA R.;OLIVEIRA, LUCIANA RENATA DE

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Doutora em Fsica pela Universidade de Bolonha, Itlia, com bacharelado e mestrado em Fsica pela Universidade Federal de Santa Maria, Brasil. Possui Ps-Doutorado em Fsica pela Universidade Federal de Santa Maria e pela University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center, EUA. Como biofsica, sua rea de interesse a modelagem computacional e estocstica de sistemas biolgicos. Possui experincia com modelagem das interaes dinmicas de receptores na membrana plasmtica, modelagem de sinalizao de cncer usando a equao mestre, modelagem de uma gota de gua em uma superfcie superhidrfica, alm de ser programadora em Matlab.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: I am a biophysicist interested in computational and stochastic modeling of biological systems. I have experience with modeling of the dynamic interactions of receptors in the plasma membrane, modeling of cancer signaling using the chemical master equation, modeling of a drop of water in a superhidrophic surface, as well as I am a programmer in Matlab.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Journal of Applied and Theoretical Physics Research

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Journal of Applied and Theoretical Physics Research (JATPR) is a double blind peer-reviewed, open access journal. JATPR is dedicated to the integration of recent developments in the field of physics i.e., from solids and liquids to elementary particles. The journal publishes original research, review, short communication etc., papers and makes them available throughout the world. The readers can read, share and download the published content without any charges.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: OLIVEIRA, L. R.;de Oliveira, L.;de Oliveira, L. R.;de Oliveira, Luciana;DE OLIVEIRA, L R;DE OLIVEIRA, LUCIANA R.;OLIVEIRA, LUCIANA RENATA DE

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: In situ Measurement of Inter-Receptor Interaction Kinetics on the Cell Surface
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Live-cell single-molecule imaging has the unique ability to capture discrete molecular interaction events in their native environment. Yet it suffers from the inherent limitation of sparse labeling, i.e. not all molecules of interest are visible at the same time.

Interactions
The question we are tackling is: Can we extrapolate from the labeled subset to the full population, thus estimate association and dissociation rates between molecules in their native environment? (Can we see the invisible?) In pursuit of this goal, we are taking a mathematical modeling approach. The basis of the approach is to build a stochastic mathematical model that mimics the biological system, e.g. receptor dynamics and interactions, and the data acquisition setup, including sparse labeling, and then to calibrate the model with single-molecule data (which are also stochastic).

For this, we are exploring stochastic model calibration strategies, such as Indirect Inference and Approximate Bayesian Computation. We are also looking into GPU programming in order to speed up our simulations and make the framework practically applicable to experimental data. Our initial tests are very promising, and suggest that this framework will eventually have the power to reveal in situ interaction kinetics between molecules. Additionally, we plan to use it to computationally multiplex data from different experiments and achieve a bigger picture understanding of inter-receptor interactions beyond what individual experiments can reveal.
